meanings.definition: To focus one's eyes or mind on something intently.
meanings.sent1: She fixates on her favorite book, reading it over and over.
meanings.sent2: He fixates on the puzzle, trying to solve it without any help.
meanings.sent3: The cat fixates on the laser pointer, chasing it around the room.
meanings.sent4: His mind fixates on the problem, unable to think about anything else.
meanings.sent5: The child fixates on the shiny toy, completely absorbed in playing with it.

meanings.definition: To become attached or obsessed with something.
meanings.sent1: He fixates on collecting stamps, always looking for new ones.
meanings.sent2: She fixates on her crush, thinking about them all the time.
meanings.sent3: The dog fixates on his favorite toy, carrying it everywhere he goes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind fixates on the idea of traveling the world, dreaming of different places.
meanings.sent5: The student fixates on getting a perfect score, studying diligently for the exam.

meanings.definition: To make something firm, stable, or secure.
meanings.sent1: They fixates the shelf to the wall to prevent it from falling.
meanings.sent2: He fixates the loose screw, making sure it doesn't come off again.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter fixates the table legs, ensuring they can support heavy weight.
meanings.sent4: She fixates the painting to the wall, making sure it hangs straight.
meanings.sent5: The engineer fixates the structure, ensuring it can withstand strong winds.
